chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald L. Dukelow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Mr. Dukelow  to 6 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 4 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, consecutive to any previously imposed sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
--to be responsible to pay restitution for counseling services for the victim up to $10,000 

--to pay restitution of $5 payable to the Crime Victim Compensation Program

--to pay statutory court costs, fees, assessment and surcharges including the DNA surcharge
--to pay statutory court costs, fees, assessment and surcharges including the DNA surcharge
--to maintain employment or pursue an education program as approved by the Agent

--no contact with K.R.K (dob 5/25/07) unless K.R.K.'s parents and the Agent agree that it is necessary for therapeutic reasons

--no presence at K.R.K.'s home, place of employment, or school

--to undergo any mental health treatment recommended by his Agent

--to take all prescription drugs as prescribed

--to undergo any other type of assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent

--Sex Offender Registration and Reporting 

--to be on Sex Offender Supervision per the Agent including  no use of the Internet or like communications without Agent authorization;  no contact with any child; not to be present in any facility where children are known to gather, including but not limited to parks, playgrounds, carnivals, waterparks or similar facilities

--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency: Fort Atkinson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 10:03am.
Defendant Ronald L. Dukelow in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (ADA Beck indicates that the victims are not present and that there has not been any victim-input); the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Dukelow guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Mr. Dukelow  to 6 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 4 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, consecutive to any previously imposed sentence.

The Court finds that Mr. Dukelow is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Dukelow is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 The Court gives  1 day credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo any mental health treatment recommended by his Agent
--to take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--to undergo any other type of assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--to maintain employment or pursue an education program as approved by the Agent
--no contact with K.R.K (dob 5/25/07) unless K.R.K.'s parents and the Agent agree that it is necessary for therapeutic reasons
--no presence at K.R.K.'s home, place of employment, or school
--Sex Offender Registration and Reporting 
--to be on Sex Offender Supervision per the Agent including  no use of the Internet or like communications without Agent authorization;  no contact with any child; not to be present in any facility where children are known to gather, including but not limited to parks, playgrounds, carnivals, waterparks or similar facilities
--to be responsible to pay restitution for counseling services for the victim up to $10,000 
--to pay restitution of $5 payable to the Crime Victim Compensation Program
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay statutory court costs, fees, assessment and surcharges including the DNA surcharge 

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 10:41am.

Plea/sentencing hearing on August 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
for Continuance of the presently scheduled Plea/Sentencing Hearing on  7/21/2016 at 1:45pm

Case called at 8:45 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Ronald L. Dukelow in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek raises competency of Mr. Dukelow
Court inquires of latest competency finding
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that last competency finding was in fall, was restored to competency. Since then have seen a decline in cognitive ability and emotional strength.
ADA Hall informs the Court she has not spoken with Mr. Dukelow, but know he has seen loss and has no reason to doubt Atty Svehlek
Court does find that reason exists to doubt the defendant's competency, orders competency exam, will also set trial dates at this time, so if the Defendant is found competent, can proceed.
Counsel to contact the Court's JA for a 2 day jury setting in 60 - 90 days from the competency hearing
ADA Hall requests to be involved in scheduling of trial due to possible vacation conflicts
Court continues bond
Recess: 8:53 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Competency Hearing 6/2/16 at 3:00 am - Send notices (2) Schedule FSSC & JT (2 days setting) 60 - 90 days from comptency hearing - Send notices **Counsel to contact Court's JA**
Status conference on April 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Reserve Judge Davis presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] case called at 2:38pm. 
Defendant Ronald L. Dukelow in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Svehlek requests the scheduling of another Status Conference rather than the scheduling a jury trial at this point.  Attorney Svhelek explains that the basis for her request involves recent family and personal hardships of Mr. Dukelow that have caused a down-turn in Mr. Dukelow's mental status. Attorney Svehlek indicates that the continued passage of time since recent family events could result in Mr. Dukelow being better able to make decisions in his case.  Attorney Svehlek feels that the scheduling of a jury trial at this point would increase Mr. Dukelow's anxiety.  
Attorney Svehlek provides further explanation that she is giving consideration to renewing a competency concern and requesting a second evaluation, however she is not prepared to do so at this point, including because she has not yet discussed this with the State. 
The Court schedules another status, directing the clerk to schedule the hearing on a date when Judge Koschnick can preside at the status conference. 
recess 2:43pm

NEXT:  Status Conference on 4/11/16 at 2:45pm.

Case called at 2:36pm [mo]
Defendant Ronald L. Dukelow in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Mr.Dukelow waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

Atty. Svehlek requests a Status out 30-45 days 
--No Objection from ADA Hall

ADA Hall raises to the Court that there needs to a modification made to Mr. Dukelow's bond as he can no longer live with his mother due to her residence within a certain zone in Jefferson County, and Mr. Dukelow being a registered sex offender. 
--Atty. Svehlek gives additional bond arguments 

The Court modifies Mr. Dukelow's bond: removing the condition that requires him to reside with his mother, and adding the conditions:
--The Defendant is required to live at 516 East Main St. in Watertown, the Washington Inn
--The Defendant is to gain permission from the Court prior to changing residence 
recess: 2:44pm

Case called at 9:28am[MO]
Defendant Ronald L. Dukelow in court with Attorney Yelena O Zarwell.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews the court file. 
Atty. Zarwell verifies that the Defense is still requesting a second competency evaluation.
ADA Beck indicates that the State is not opposed to this request.
The Court and Counsel discuss competency hearing statutes.
The Court finds that the required Competency Hearing has commenced, but is not being concluded.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
The Court strikes the verbage on the Defense's order stating within 45 days, and replaces it with the date of the continued competency hearing.
The Court orders a second evaluation, appointing Dr. William A. Merrick to conduct the examination. His report is to be filed within 30 days from today.
The Court verifies with ADA Beck that there is victim rights compliance.
Recess: 9:45am

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Order of commitment for treatment

case called at 10:44am. 
Defendant Ronald L. Dukelow in court with Attorney Yelena O Zarwell.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Both counsel acknowledge receipt of the Competency Evaluation Report; both are in agreement with the evaluator's conclusion.
In response to the Court's inquiry of Mr. Dukelow individually, Mr. Dukelow agrees he is currently not competent. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court finds that Mr. Dukelow is currently not competent to proceed, but if provided with appropriate medication and treatment, Mr. Dukelow is likely to become competent.
The Court commits Mr. Dukelow to the Department of Health Services for a indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months;  one day credit for pre-commitment incarceration is given. 
The Court finds that there is no indication that involuntary administration of medications or treatment is needed at this time. 
The Court indicates that it is not opposed to using the outpatient competency restoration program. 
recess 10:52am.
[Post-Hearing/Off-Record the Court clarifies to the clerk that the case is now in suspended-status. MK]

for Modification of Bond:
Stipulation:
Parties stipulate to signature bond conditions be modified to delete the following language: "Continue living with his mother so long as his mother lives in the counties that he is limited to traveling within" and replace it with the following language  "Continue living with a family member so long as his family member lives in the counties that he is limited to traveling within."

Order:
It is hereby ordered that the conditions of signature bond aare modified as set forth above. All other conditions of the bond remain in effect. Mr. Dukelow need not sign a new bond.

Case called at 1:15 pm
Defendant Ronald L. Dukelow in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charge and maximum penalties recited
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Count #1.
The Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $50,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-Not to leave the State of Wisconsin
-Not leave Jefferson County or any adjoining county Columbia, Rock, Dane, Dodge, Waukesha or Walworth
-No contact with K.R.K. (DOB: 5/25/2007) or any of K.R.K.'s family members to the extent that he knows who K.R.K's  family members are
-Not to be alone with any person that is a minor or that he should reasonably know is a minor
-Not to have any physical contact with any minor
-Comply with Sex Offender Registry
-Continue living with his mother so long as his mother lives in the counties that he is limitied to traveling within

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit.

Recess: 1:32 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: to10/3/14 at 9:00 am
